channel.title: FIFA.com - 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ - News
channel.description: Visit FIFA.com for footballing news from across the world plus interviews and the chance to comment on the beautiful game.

image.title: FIFA.com - 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ - News

item.title: Panamanian futbol's paradisiacal year
item.description: Panamanian futbol has relished an annus mirabilis. Panama did not just swim in the sport’s most prestigious canal in 2018, but made a splash in other waters.

item.title: More than half the world watched record-breaking 2018 World Cup
item.description: FIFA has today published the key findings of a comprehensive audit of consolidated final audience data for the 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™, which was broadcast live in every territory around the world from 14 June to 15 July this year.

item.title: Kylian Mbappe: All by the age of 20
Wu Lei: World Cup place is China's only aim
Zeneli, Kosovo coming of age together
Relive the emotions of the 2018 World Cup with the help of this e-book
item.description: Relive the emotions of the 2018 World Cup with the help of this e-book

item.title: Qatar unveils spectacular design for Lusail Stadium
item.description: The remaining and perhaps most-anticipated design of the eight stadiums proposed by the Supreme Committee for Delivery & Legacy (SC) to host the 2022 FIFA World Cup Qatar™ was unveiled today at a colourful gala event held at the Lusail Harbour, 15km north from Doha.

item.title: FIFA shares the benefits of Russia 2018 with 416 clubs around the globe
Mabil’s journey from refugee to role model
FIFA President looks ahead to mark four years until Qatar 2022
item.description: While the ink is only just drying on the 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ chapter in football's history books, eyes are already starting to gaze forward longingly to the next edition, as we pass the four-year mark ahead of Qatar 2022.

item.title: Hat-trick hero Seferovic: Switzerland's striking solution?
item.description: After his hat-trick against Belgium, is Seferovic the answer for Switzerland?

item.title: Orange is the new blue
item.description: Orange is the new blue

item.title: Capela: I'd love to be a soccer pundit
Willian eyes Brazil victory at their London ‘home from home’
Young Dragons taking flight
Osorio has big plans for Paraguay
item.description: Osorio has big plans for Paraguay

item.title: FIFA President praises Qatar 2022 infrastructure progress during whistle-stop tour
item.description: FIFA President Gianni Infantino has praised Qatar’s infrastructure progress and described the 2022 FIFA World Cup™ as a unique opportunity for football fans to experience a new culture and region during a whistle-stop tour of the country.

item.title: 100 days on, still going strong
item.description: Remember the pundits who said players coming off an exhausting FIFA World Cup™ would struggle to find their form in 2018/19? Well, a crop of Russia 2018 stars have made a mockery of that fear.

item.title: Triumphant return for Alcacer
item.description: After two and a half years in the international wilderness, the Dortmund striker was recalled to the Spain team and scored three times in two games. FIFA.com takes a closer look at his rich vein of form.

item.title: FIFA Technical Study Group publishes 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia report
Predictor champ’s unforgettable Russia 2018 adventure
item.description: The 2017 FIFA Predictor champion Geoff Guttmann tells FIFA.com about the trip he won to the Russia 2018 semi-final between France and Belgium with his wife.

item.title: A throwback to Russia 2018, looking ahead at Qatar 2022
item.description: Three months after France lifted the 2018 FIFA World Cup™ and a great sense of achievement took over the Russian people following such a successful event, key members of the Local Organising Committee’s operational staff gathered with FIFA in Zurich to debrief on the tournament. Joining the 30 participants from Moscow and eager to assimilate the main lessons learnt by the previous hosts, were another 26 experts from Qatar’s Supreme Committee for Delivery & Legacy and the Local Organising Committee.

item.title: Matosas named new Costa Rica coach
item.description: Former Uruguay international Gustavo Matosas has been named to lead Costa Rica ahead of their FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022™ qualifying campaign.

item.title: African underdogs aim to upset odds again
New kids on the international block
Southgate signs on for four more years
Captain Socceroo says farewell
Akinfeev retires from Russia duty
Football family gathers to grow together
item.description: The FIFA Football Conference, staged in London on Sunday, brought together the coaches of almost 200 member associations to discuss the principal trends that emerged from Russia 2018. At the end of the event, some of the key participants shared their experiences.

item.title: FIFA Football Conference identifies emerging trends and tactics from 2018 FIFA World Cup™
item.description: 70 days after the 2018 FIFA World Cup™ Final, coaches and technical experts from nearly 200 member associations and all confederations gathered at the FIFA Football Conference in London today to analyse the latest footballing trends and tactics showcased at this summer’s showpiece event in Russia.

item.title: RELIVE: Watch the experts at the FIFA Football Conference
Tabarez signs four-year contract renewal with Uruguay
item.description: The Uruguay Football Association announced that an agreement has been reached between long-time head coach Oscar Tabarez and his staff to continue leading the national team for another four years.

item.title: How the deaf and hard of hearing community watched Russia 2018
item.description: As well as FIFATV on YouTube and FIFA.com providing all the goals and match highlights from an unforgettable tournament in Russia, round-ups of all 64 matches were also produced by FIFA for the deaf and hard of hearing in International Sign Language.

item.title: Russia 2018 takes centre stage at FIFA Football Conference in London
Russia 2018 fairy tale in the eyes of the fans
item.description: The memories of the 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ hosts' extraordinary moments in June and July are still fresh in the minds of Russian supporters, who gave their perspective on the Sbornaya’s performance in this video feature.

item.title: Celebrating the best of Russia 2018
item.description: Sit back, relax and savour the ingredients that went into making this year’s 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ one for the ages.

item.title: Panini World Cup Winners announced!
African big names back firing amid some surprises
item.description: FIFA.com rounds up Matchday 2 of the qualifying competition for the 2019 CAF Africa Cup of Nations, to be held next June in Cameroon.

item.title: Kane receives adidas Golden Boot at Wembley
item.description: Before England’s UEFA Nations League opener against Spain on Saturday, 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ top goalscorer Harry Kane was presented with the adidas Golden Boot award at Wembley Stadium.

item.title: New starts and new faces in Africa
item.description: With Africa abuzz again as qualifying resumes for the CAF Africa Cup of Nations,** FIFA.com **highlights the major recent developments on the continent's football scene.

item.title: Tite's five fresh samba starlets
Parreira on Russia 2018: Possession is no longer a must
Pekerman steps down as Colombia coach
Osorio named new Paraguay boss
Qatar invites volunteers to help prepare for 2022 FIFA World Cup™
item.description: People from Qatar and across the world have been invited to register their interest in volunteering to support preparations for the 2022 FIFA World Cup™, the first World Cup in the Arab world.

item.title: Griezmann: World Cup win hasn't fully sunk in yet
item.description: FIFA World Cup™ winner and Atletico Madrid striker Antoine Griezmann sat down with FIFA.com to reflect on a very eventful few months in his life.

item.title: Ferretti named Mexico interim coach
item.description: The Mexican Football Federation has confirmed that Tigres UANL head coach Ricardo "Tuca" Ferretti will coach the senior men's national team for their upcoming September friendlies against Uruguay and USA.

item.title: Deschamps to attend FIFA Football Conference in London
item.description: FIFA World Cup™-winning coach Didier Deschamps will share his view on France’s path to glory at the FIFA Football Conference in London on 23 September 2018.

item.title: Russia still gripped by Dzyuba-mania
item.description: As Russia soar in the World Ranking, FIFA.com looks at the impact made - on and off the pitch - by fans' favourite Artem Dzyuba.
